page.title: 04JOINT EUROPEAN TORUS (JET)
page.content:
The JET project is aimed at proving the feasibility of nuclear fusion as a new energy source. The members of the JET Joint Undertaking are the European Atomic Energy Community, all its associated partners on the fusion programme along with Greece, Ireland and Luxembourg. The project was established in 1978 for a period of twelve years.
The aim of the JET project is to obtain a plasma with a size, density and temperature comparable to the values needed in an eventual power producing reactor. Achieving the required plasma on JET will be a major step forward, but many other difficult problems will have to be overcome before an economic fusion reactor can be built.
